page.title: 01VILLAGE SURVEY
page.content: Witheridge is a small Devon village situated on the A373 between Tiverton and South Molton.It is surrounded by a large farming area,mainly sheep and dairy farms.It has a population of 700-750 and is a mixture of old thatched cottages and new bungalow estates.Witheridge is about 600 feet above sea level and is one of the highest points between Exmoor and Dartmoor.For a small village it is well served with shops and has a baker,butcher,dairy and post office,as well as a newspaper shop,garage,two hotels and a bank.It is a lively community with numerous clubs and societies and boasts its own primary school for infants and juniors.There is an old peoples home,a church,two chapels and it even has its own doctors'surgery as well as a vets surgery.
